home.name: Krishna GSVV
home.description: I'm a passionate developer who loves creating innovative solutions and bringing ideas to life through code. Always eager to learn new technologies and contribute to meaningful projects.

profileImage.note: Set type to 'github' to use GitHub profile image, 'display' to use display.profileImage, or 'custom' to use customUrl

home.note: Configure the home page content - greeting, name, typewriter strings, description, profile image settings, buttons, social links, and animations

about.heading: About Me
about.title: I'm Krishna GSVV, a passionate developer
paragraphs: I'm a dedicated software developer with a passion for creating innovative web applications and solving complex problems through code. My journey in technology began with curiosity and has evolved into a professional pursuit of excellence.

I specialize in modern web technologies, with expertise in React, Node.js, Python frameworks and various databases. I enjoy working on both frontend and backend development, always striving to create seamless user experiences backed by robust server-side architecture.

When I'm not coding, you can find me exploring new technologies, contributing to open-source projects, or sharing my knowledge with the developer community. I believe in continuous learning and staying updated with the latest industry trends.

image.note: Set type to 'github' to use GitHub profile image, 'home' to use same as home page, or 'custom' to use customUrl

about.note: Configure the About page content - heading, subheading, title, paragraphs, image settings, skills section heading, and skills categories with items
about.skillsNote: Available category icons: DevicePhoneMobileIcon, ServerIcon, CpuChipIcon, CodeBracketIcon. Available skill icons: FaReact, FaNodeJs, FaPython, FaGitAlt, FaDocker, FaAws, FaHtml5, FaCss3Alt, FaJsSquare, FaVuejs, FaAngular, FaPhp, FaJava, FaDatabase, SiJavascript, SiTypescript, SiMongodb, SiPostgresql, SiTailwindcss, SiExpress, SiNextdotjs, SiNestjs, SiRedis, SiGraphql, SiKubernetes, SiLinux, SiGit, SiFirebase, SiVercel, SiNetlify, and more.
about.statsNote: Configure the stats section - each stat should have a 'number' and 'label' field. You can add/remove stats as needed. Examples: { "number": "3+", "label": "Years Experience" }, { "number": "75+", "label": "Projects Completed" }, { "number": "500+", "label": "GitHub Commits" }, { "number": "15+", "label": "Technologies" }

staticProjects.name: Krishna GSVV Portfolio
staticProjects.description: A modern, responsive portfolio website built with React, Vite, and Tailwind CSS. Features dynamic GitHub repository fetching, beautiful animations, and a comprehensive configuration system that makes it fully customizable through a single JSON file.
highlights: Fully responsive design with mobile-first approach
Dynamic GitHub repository integration with real-time fetching
Comprehensive configuration system - no code changes needed
Beautiful animations powered by Framer Motion
JSON Schema support for IntelliSense in VS Code

projects.staticProjectsNote: Configure static projects when mode is set to 'static'. Each project should have: id, name, description, technologies array, category, featured (boolean), status, startDate, endDate (null for ongoing), githubUrl, liveUrl, demoUrl, documentationUrl, imageUrl, tags array, highlights array, and stats object with stars/forks/watchers/issues

publications.title: Predicting Sevearity of Type 2 Diabetic Retinopathy Using Retinal Fundus Images with new DeepLearning Architectures from the Inception and Resnet Families
publications.description: Due to its high morbidity and medical expenses, DR mellitus (T2DM) is a serious global health concern. Its burden can be lessened with effective early prognosis, but the available treatments are not enough. Predictive modelling of Retina Images (fundus) can enhance early diagnosis and care quality. Advanced convolutional neural networks (Inception-V4, ResNet V1, and ResNet V2) are used in this study to assess the severity of Diabetic Retinopathy caused by T2DM. Using de-identified fundus data from 9,948 individuals (1,904 with a T2DM diagnosed), we used transfer learning to train these models. We have performed simple data augmentation to rectify the class imbalance. The accuracy and AUC of the ensemble model were 94.21% and 98.53%, respectively. The findings imply that the combination of ResNet and Inception-V4 enhances classification power, providing a viable approach for early T2DM identification from fundus data that may find use in clinical settings. Future research still needs to focus on improving sensitivity and integrating real-time.

personalProjects.name: CounterAPI
personalProjects.description: Developed FastAPI analytics microservice with PostgreSQL for zero-code visitor tracking, featuring real-time dashboards and few-click cloud deployment. Automated CI/CD pipeline, optimizing for high performance and reliability.

personalProjects.name: cSpell Sync
personalProjects.description: Created VS Code extension for bidirectional cSpell dictionary sync, supporting custom dictionaries, project settings, and global configurations. Gained 500+ installs on VS Code Marketplace, driven by features like automatic sync, keyboard shortcuts, and status bar integration.

personalProjects.name: HiveXplore
personalProjects.description: Developed user-friendly web application (Flask, JavaScript) as a gateway to decentralized social media blockchain, featuring intuitive content creation, multi-method authentication (Hive Keychain, HiveSigner, HiveAuth), and a robust demo mode for easy onboarding to blockchain technology.

personalProjects.name: Indian Sign Language Detector
personalProjects.description: Built real-time sign language translator using Python, OpenCV, MediaPipe achieving 98% accuracy with interactive web UI and custom model training for accessibility communication.

resume.personalProjectsNote: Configure personal projects - each should have name, technologies array (with icon and color), period, description, githubUrl (optional), liveUrl (optional), demoUrl (optional), documentationUrl (optional)

social.note: Configure all social media platforms here. Set enabled: true and provide URL to activate. Use showInHome, showInFooter, showInContact to control where each platform appears. To add new platforms, add a new object with name, key, icon, url, label, color, hoverColor, and show flags. Available icons: FaGithub, FaLinkedin, FaTwitter, FaInstagram, FaDiscord, FaYoutube, FaTwitch, FaTiktok, FaMedium, FaDev, FaStackOverflow, FaDribbble, FaBehance, FaCodepen, ArrowUpIcon, Bars3Icon, XMarkIcon

contact.title: Let's Connect
contact.subtitle: I'm always interested in new opportunities and collaborations. Let's build something amazing together!

status.message: Available for new opportunities and collaborations

currentFocus.title: What I'm Working On
currentFocus.description: Building AI-powered web applications, contributing to open source projects, and exploring new technologies in web development and machine learning.

faq.question: What's your typical response time?
faq.answer: I usually respond to emails and messages within 5 business days at max. For urgent matters, feel free to mention it in the subject line.

faq.question: What types of projects do you work on?
faq.answer: I specialize in full-stack web development, AI integration, and modern React applications. I'm open to both short-term consulting and longer-term collaborations.

faq.question: Are you available for freelance work?
faq.answer: Yes! I'm always interested in discussing interesting projects. Feel free to reach out with your project details and timeline.

faq.question: Do you mentor or teach?
faq.answer: Absolutely! I enjoy helping others learn programming and web development. I'm available for mentoring sessions and code reviews.

contact.note: Configure the contact page layout, sections, and content. The contact page supports a flexible two-column layout with configurable sections. You can rearrange sections, change titles, add/remove sections, and control what content appears where. Available section types: 'contactInfo' (email, phone, location), 'currentFocus' (what you're working on), 'quickActions' (action buttons with icons), 'github' (GitHub profiles), 'social' (social media platforms), 'collaboration' (collaboration interests). Each section can be shown/hidden and have custom titles. The 'github' and 'social' sections automatically pull from the configured platforms and will display in a grid layout. Platforms with descriptions will be displayed horizontally with text, while simple platforms will show as icon-only cards. Social platforms can be filtered to show only on contact page by setting showInContact: true and other show flags to false.
